law.catch_line: Using slugs in the second degree.

text.section:
A person is guilty of unlawfully using slugs in the second degree when:
With intent to defraud the owner, licensee or lessee of a coin machine, he inserts, deposits or uses a slug in such machine; or
He makes, possesses or disposes of a slug with intent to enable a person to insert, deposit or use it in a coin machine.
Unlawfully using slugs in the second degree is a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 144, effective January 1, 1975.
